Extras! Pathways, univeristy, useful links and more! 🚀 Pathways @ Heretaunga Not sure what comes after school? Don’t stress — Heretaunga offers Pathways support to help you explore what’s next. 🎯 Uni? Apprenticeship? Gap year? Straight into a job? We can help you:
  • Plan your subjects around future goals
  • Connect with STAR courses, Gateway, and work experience
  • Build a CV and prep for interviews
💬 Talk to the careers team or your Dean to get started! 🌆 After-School OpportunitiesThere’s more to Heretaunga than just the school day. Check out:
  • 🎭 Drama and music groups
  • 🧪 Science clubs and coding workshops
  • ⚽ Sports teams and fitness groups
  • 📚 Study hubs and tutoring
These are great for making friends and picking up useful skills and experience!

✈️ Transitioning into NCEA from OverseasNew to NZ and wondering how your previous school system fits into NCEA? We’ve helped heaps of students transition from:
  • Cambridge (IGCSE/A-Levels)
  • IB
  • US or Australian curriculum
  • and more!
Here’s what happens:
  • We match your previous learning to suitable NCEA levels
  • You’ll get support adjusting to the internal/external assessment system
  • ESOL and pastoral care are available if needed
✍️ Reach out to the International Dean or your form teacher — they’re here to help.


🧑‍🏫 What’s a Principal’s Nominee? Good question! Normally, every school has a Principal’s Nominee — someone who’s the go-between for the school and NZQA. 👉 At Heretaunga College, we don’t currently have one – but that just means your Dean or subject teacher is your first stop for NCEA help or issues. Still unsure? Email the office or ask your form teacher.


🔗 Useful Links Need to check your credits or find NCEA info? Here are some quick links:

🌐 NZQA Learner Login – Track your credits & results

🌐 Heretaunga School Portal – Track your credits, results and attendance from one place!

📘 Heretaunga College Website – Key dates, contacts & news

🎓 Careers NZ – Explore job pathways, CV builder & more

📱 StudyIt – Study tips, forums & subject help for NCEA students

📎 Subject Selection Info – Learn about different subjects, and make your choices!



✅ Final Tips
  • Don't wait until Term 4 to ask questions
  • Keep track of your credits during the year
  • Get involved — the more you try, the more confident you’ll feel
  • Use your teachers — they’re here for YOU
  • This forum is a safe space, so feel free to post questions or share advice
